attributes.action: Remove David Davis from his position as 'Brexit' Secretary.
attributes.additional_details:
David Davis has claimed on many occasions that reports which “analyse the impact of Brexit” in “excruciating detail” have been undertaken.

Knowing that no such reports exist, he allowed a vote to go ahead in parliament, which decided that that the reports must be released.

In response, it was claimed that the reports would be released within a few weeks.

He has now admitted that the reports have never existed.
attributes.background: David Davis has deliberately misled parliament for an extended period of time, to the extent that he allowed a parliamentary vote to take place over the release of non-existent 'Brexit' impact assessments.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for MPs or Cabinet Ministers to be sacked.

 If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
